page.title: 06BENWELL STREET NAMES
page.content: Armstrong Road is one of the most important roads in this are and was named after{W.G.Armstrong}who invented the Armstrong Gun.He built the Armstrong engineering works on Scotswood Road and designed the Swing Bridge over the River Tyne. { Scotswood Road}was named after Jack Scott who later gave his name to Eldon Square when he became Lord Eldon.Born in 1751 he became Chancellor of England.He had earlier eloped with a local girl named Bessie Surtees. The flats called{Kings Meadows}are named after the island that used to be in the middle of the River Tyne. It was removed so that large ships could sail up the river.Cruddas Park is named after Cruddas who was a partner of Armstrong's. The Cruddas family paid for the building of St.Stevens church.
